intro: Stenocarpus comptonii, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a member of the Cyatheaceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can live for many decades, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fronds are typically green on the upper surface and lighter in color on the underside. Stenocarpus comptonii plays an important role in the ecological systems of New Zealand's forests.
